channel.title: Goals-habits on Colin Spear
channel.description: Recent content in Goals-habits on Colin Spear

item.description: Learning list addiction applied math statistics causal inference finish causal inference mixtape a solid, intuitive understanding of selection bias, selection on observables and selection on unobservables machine learning deep learning fast.ai course computer science program design a better understanding of how the internet works programming docker a deep learning framework work “soft” skills managing people Baudrillard Keats

item.title: Identity goals
item.description: Identity goals This is inspired by Atomic Habits. I wrote them when I read the book then forgot about them for some time. After a while I returned to reread them and found it to be a useful recentering device. So I’m keeping them for now. Goals: I want to be the type of person who is competent at statistics, machine learning, causal inference and software engineering I don’t drink more often than I do drink.

item.title: Implementation intentions
item.description: Implementation intentions Template: I will {BEHAVIOR} at {TIME} in {LOCATION} Implementation Intentions: Daily Every day before I sit down at my desk, I will do two Sun salutations I will start work when I first sit down at my desk on Monday, Wednesday and Friday. I will work on a personal coding project for at least fifteen minutes and no more than an hour when I first sit down at my desk on Tuesday and Thursday.
